alternative_parents.description: Purines that carry a C=O group at position 6. Purine is a bicyclic aromatic compound made up of a pyrimidine ring fused to an imidazole ring.
alternative_parents.name: 6-oxopurines

alternative_parents.description: Naturally occurring chemical compounds that contain mostly basic nitrogen atoms. This group also includes some related compounds with neutral and even weakly acidic properties. Also some synthetic compounds of similar structure are attributed to alkaloids. In addition to carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen, alkaloids may also contain oxygen, sulfur and more rarely other elements such as chlorine, bromine, and phosphorus.
alternative_parents.name: Alkaloids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds that contain a pyrimidine ring, which bears a ketone. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrimidones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an imidazole ring, which is an aromatic five-member ring with two nitrogen atoms at positions 1 and 3, and three carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Imidazoles

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing two amine groups joined by a carbonyl (C=O) functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Ureas

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a lactam ring, which is a cyclic amide of amino carboxylic acids, having a 1-azacycloalkan-2-one structure (or an analogue having unsaturation or heteroatoms replacing one or more carbon atoms of the ring).
alternative_parents.name: Lactams

alternative_parents.description: Ionic derivatives of carboxylic acid.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acid salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a transition metal atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic transition metal salts

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the dialkyl ether functional group, with the formula ROR', where R and R' are alkyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkyl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a sodium ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic sodium salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxoanion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxoanionic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Organic polycyclic compounds containing an imidazole ring fused to a pyrimidine ring. Imidazole is 5-membered ring consisting of three carbon atoms, and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3-positions. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
class.name: Imidazopyrimidines

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as xanthines. These are purine derivatives with a ketone group conjugated at carbons 2 and 6 of the purine moiety.

direct_parent.description: Purine derivatives with a ketone group conjugated at carbons 2 and 6 of the purine moiety.
direct_parent.name: Xanthines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring.
subclass.name: Purines and purine derivatives

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
